name: Holiday Inn Express Atlanta Airport

reviews.text: When I stay near the airport, the hotel shuttle service is important to me. In the case of this hotel, the shuttle is VERY SLOW, it runs whenever they feel like - seemed to me and others waiting, it was very frustrating to see all the other hotel shuttles come back again and be told on the phone by the hotel that "is coming in 5 minutes" which of course was not the case.
reviews.title: Good if you book through Hotwire and similar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just "a hotel". Public areas seemed renovated, clean, spacious enough, quiet ... I just hated the small windows, gave a claustrophobic feeling to the box, I mean the room !! ... that is how it feels ! Didn't like the sink out of the bathroom either.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.text: What I did like and made up for all these other things, was the free breakfast, buffet style, eat all you want. Of course don't expect omelettes or benedict eggs, but the variety was good enough to take you to the airport and save up to 20 dollars on fast food breakfasts there. They even had self-made pan cakes, which we all found amusing and good to eat.
reviews.title: Pretty nice!

likes.liked: — Great location near airport and I-85, great staff.
likes.disliked: — Didn't get two beds as requested.

reviews.text: We arrived for one night at the Holiday Inn Express. Room was very beat up and musty smelling. At about 3AM we heard a sound coming from the bathroom as if the faucet was on - we though it was only the shower leaking. Heard it again around 4:30AM and decided to get up to see what it was all about. There was a leak coming through the bathroom ceiling of an off-color water. It was coming from the room above us. Immediately packed our stuff and went down to the desk to complain. The lady behind the desk was not helpful nor apologetic and only offered a $30 discount off of our bill. We are still working with Holiday Inn in hopes that we receive a full refund. Not recommended...
reviews.title: OK, looks like hotel sees a LOT of HARD ABUSE

likes.disliked: — grubby, banged up public areas, stinky elevator

reviews.title: Ok for the money
reviews.text: Booked through Priceline - got a rate of $84. Not too bad. Only stayed one night. Easy to find off I-85. We checked in - Malcolm was behind the counter as was a woman whose name I did not get. Both were fabulously helpful and accommodating. The woman gave us some information we'd been needing about directions, etc. Malcolm was pleasant and cheerful and we had a good time talking to him.

Not bad at all ! Free shuttle, free breakfast (very good waffle maker). booked with expedia and check in was a breeze. free wireless internet and literally 5 minutes from the airport. close to restaurants. would stay here again
reviews.title: Awesome for the price and location
Staff not bad, but hotel itself is a dump!
reviews.text: Probably one of the biggest dumps I've ever stayed in. I have nothing nice to say about the facilities. The staff, on the other hand, was curteous and seemed attentive (although I never needed anything). I would rate the staff 3 stars, the breakfast 2 or 3 stars, and the facilities 1 star. Perhaps this all happened after they changed over from the Comfort Inn to the Peachtree Hotel Atlanta Airport, but somehow I doubt it.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: Recently stayed here overnight between flights and it was perfect. No frills but all we needed was a place to sleep and shower. The airport shuttle was very convenient and they have a nice breakfast. The price was very reasonable, about $80 all told. Definately recommend to travelers who just need a place to sleep. Not much choice in food, though, so grab a bite before you leave the airport!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Atlanta Airport Hotel College Park
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Atlanta Airport hotel. We are located adjacent to Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport (ATL) and MARTA yet only 8 miles from downtown Atlanta. Both corporate and leisure travelers will experience the utmost in Southern hospitality. The Holiday Inn Express Atlanta Airport hotel is located off I-85 at exit 71. At our hotel we offer a complimentary hot Express Start breakfast buffet, quiet rest in our soundproof rooms, complimentary 24-hour shuttle service to the airport and MARTA, complimentary high-speed Internet access, a business center, a fitness center and a seasonal outdoor pool to name a few of our personalized amenities. Businesses near our hotel include Chick-fil-a Corporate Offices, Coca Cola, Naturally Fresh, Inc, Mannheim Auto Auction, John Wieland Homes, Delta Airlines, Airtran Airways, Alteon Flight Training, DHL, Federal Express and World Changers Ministry. Attractions near our hotel include Georgia World Congress Center, Georgia International Convention Center, Georgia Aquarium, Centennial Olympic Park, CNN Center, Underground Atlanta, World of Coca-Cola, Turner Field 'Home of the Braves', Martin Luther King Jr. National Historic Site and Atlanta Motor Speedway. Universities in the area include Georgia Tech, Emory University, Spelman College, Georgia State, Clark Atlanta University and Clayton State College.
